excerpt: The Last of Us, Law & Order: Organized Crime, Leverage and more! Find out what's new, returning and leaving the small screen over the next seven days.

To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find nine new shows (including Josh Duhamel and Minka Kelly in Ransom Canyon, David Oyelowo in Government Cheese and Ramy Youssefâ€™s animated comedy #1 Happy Family USA), 16 returning favorites (including The Last of Us, Law & Order: Organized Crime and Leverage: Redemption) and dozen finales (including the very last episode of Bosch: Legacy).

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

This stranger-than-fiction crime caper follows the attempted robbery of a precious gem, told by the gangsters who did it and the police on their tail.

ðŸ“º Government Cheese (Apple TV+, four-episode premiere)
David Oyelowo stars in this surrealist, â€™60s-set comedy about a quirky family pursuing lofty (and seemingly impossible) dreams.

THURSDAY, APRIL 17

Ramy Youssefâ€™s animated comedy follows the most patriotic, most peaceful, and most definitely-not-suspicious Muslim family in post-9/11 America.
